text: The image is spectacular, aglow in DUSK LIGHT: a beautifu just born, held in a WOMAN'S HANDS. It is being cleaned; water runs down its face and body. TIGHT ON the MIDWIFE (female, 60's) who holds and cleans baby as it CRIES. Another, younger, Midwife can be seen b her, assisting with the pitchers of water. As she cleans baby, she says to someone OFF-CAMERA:

He is strong. The baby, now calm, gets SWADDLED.    He is then gently h to the new MOTHER: AMANDA GRAYSON, late 20's. An original beauty. She lies o divan, spent but eager to hold her first child. She tende takes the infant into her arms, tears in her eyes, mesmer She holds the wrapped baby tight and whispers sweetly:
... hello. CLOSE ON the YOUNGER MIDWIFE, standing at the rear of the She raises an eyebrow as she quietly speaks:
The baby is healthy. Why does she cry?
(a beat; then)
She is human. A distant, quiet BUZZ -- and the elder Midwife stands, lo into the distance. And this is when we see, for the first that the Midwife has POINTED EARS.
Sarek arrives. The Midwife moves away -- we PUSH IN on Amanda, who looks a moment, clearly disquieted.

A planet of massive, tortured ROCK FORMS, distant cities constructed atop and underneath them. A HOVER-SPEEDER in mid-ground kicks up dust, backlit by the sun, as it trace horizon. We PAN WITH IT, revealing a FAMILY HOME, built seamlessly into a rocky mountainside. A SUPER READS: STARDATE 2230.06. The speeder parks outside the home --
SAREK (late 40's, a Vulcan) comes out to the balcony thro rear doors of the home. He moves to Amanda and kneels. He looks at the child -- his child -- and says:
Well done. She looks at him for a beat, then says, flatly -- with ju enough rancor:
Thanks. He regards her.   Knows he's in TROUBLE --
Your tone suggests disappointment. The Science Council required my presence for a session regarding--

Don't do that.     You knew I wanted you here. The Vulcan Midwives share a look. Sarek glances at them. The two women excuse themselves. Sarek reaches over, touc small touchpad -- the HARPSICHORD MUSIC STOPS. He says, clinically:
As you are aware, the Vulcan male is traditionally not present at the moment of delivery.
Well traditionally, I'm not the one giving birth. (then)
I moved here -- to another planet -- to be with you. I needed you to be with me today. Holding my hand and telling me I'm doing great, even when I'm just... breathing the best I can.
Sad that she has to tell him this at all, she just looks the baby -- finding comfort in his innocence. Sarek consi this. He moves closer to her. Whispers intimately:
You are correct. I should have been here. I am sorry.
And with her free hand, she pulls Sarek closer -- and kis him. And the two look at the baby.
I had a thought. That we might name the child after one of our respected early society-builders. His name was "Spock".
She looks at the baby, not immediately taken by the name.
Your silence does not suggest enormous enthusiasm.
No... Spock. (smiles, touches his face) ... Spock.
She looks at Sarek: Spock it is.
The child has your eyes.
She pulls back the baby's swaddling, revealing his ears. gently rubs the top of his right ear -- AND IT UNFURLS, revealing a small, soft pointed VULCAN EAR.
... and your ears.

And off the image of this TINY BABY, half-human, half-Vul we... FADE OUT. And over BLACKNESS, we BEGIN TO HEAR an A SOUNDING -- GROWING -- and the SUPER "THREE YEARS LATER" -- and finally the BLACKNESS IS SPLIT BY TURBO-LIFT DOORS OPENING and we REVEAL THAT WE'RE ON:
With URGENCY, we MOVE DOWN a corridor with CAPTAIN ROBAU

-- our sensors haven't made        -- no sir, it looked l sense of the anomaly?              lightning storm in the -- how far are we from the         of space -- Klingon Neutral Zone?              -- 150,000 kilometers, vessel is not Klingon, Sir, its registry doesn't match any recorded profile --
SHWISH! The doors part and we enter THE BRIDGE OF THE SHI flurry of activity -- the MASSIVE SHIP they are approachi the VIEWSCREEN. Robau moves to the center -- then he asks
Report. -- turning to the ship's FIRST OFFICER: 32, all-American swiveling in a console chair to FACE US:
Sir, new contact bearing zero-three-four.
Are they transmitting on any       Negative, Captain -- a frequency?                         communications appear shut down.
Hail the ship. What's the          Nothing even close, Si closest match on registry? Robau moves to Pitts:
Any response?
No Sir -- hails met with silence.
Maybe they're incapable -- any identifiable damage?
Negative, Sir -- but our readings seem confused--
Confused?
-- not only is the ship unregistered -- but even its construction materials seem unrecognizable.
Robau sits in the captain's chair his eyes on the ship as approach -- and we SEE IT on the VIEWSCREEN -- THE NARADA ENORMOUS AND THREATENING. He doesn't even realize that he
... oh my God... (to himself, boggled) A lightning storm... then this... (to deck) Signal all departments: first contact protocols. Looks like we have someone new on the block. All Stop.
And in the endless vacuum of space, and in TOTAL SILENCE, Kelvin appears as a dot, coming to a stop in front of the gigantic BLACK CLAW that is the Narada --
Crew members are glued to their telemetry, working consol
Sir, should we initiate an invasive scan?
That could be seen as an act of provocation -- all readings passive--
Suddenly, a WARNING BEEP --
Sir, I have a reading -- they've locked weapons on us!     -- Red alert!   Arm wea ALARMS BLARE -- LIGHTS GO RED as --
The Narada FIRES a TORPEDO -- IT HEADS FOR THE KELVIN -- SEPARATES, fracturing into a multi-hit projectile --
Officers SCRAMBLE, brace for impact --
Torpedo locked on us at 320 degrees, mark two -- incoming      -- Evasive pattern Del fast!
A direct hit SMASHES several decks along the DISH of the
In the massive Engine Room, a HUGE BLAST -- MEN GO FLYING
Captain Robau helps a fallen CREW MEMBER up from the floo then, on his chair com.:
Damage report! INTERCUT with:
Moving with the Kelvin's CHIEF ENGINEER:

Our shields did nothing, Sir! Never seen anything like it! Weapons off-line! Main power at 38 percent! As the crew regains their footing, the First Officer pull himself to his console, true fear in his eyes as he place inter-ship call -- it's RINGING -- his fear grows with ev passing RING -- then, we INTERCUT WITH:
A WOMAN, 25, answers her communicator -- she lies on an e table, afraid -- and pregnant. This is WINONA.
-- what was that-- what's happening?!
But the First Officer is just relieved that she's still a
-- you're okay-- thank God-- where are you?
Medical bay-- I had a few close contractions-- I'm fine-- what was that?
Just sit tight-- stay there-- we'll be fine--
Or maybe not:
They're firing another, Captain!
ANOTHER NARADA TORPEDO -- it SEPARATES, pieces HIT the Ke
Chief Engineer RUNS past us -- CONSUMED BY A SUDDEN EXPLO
A FEMALE CREW MEMBER running down the hall suddenly HOLDS a HOLE IS RIPPED IN THE HALL -- and she's YANKED OUT OF T CORRIDOR -- the CAMERA finally getting sucked out too!

-- life support failing on           -- this is the U.S.S decks seven through thirteen!        attemping to reach S We have confirmed casualties,        command on subspace! Sir!                                 U.S.S. Kelvin, under

-- shields at eleven percent         -- were our shields and dropping! Ten percent --         That was like nothin we're at nine! Eight percent!        ever seen -- this sh Seven! We're dropping here!          take another hit lik Six!
All remaining power to forward shields! Prepare the shuttles f--
And he STOPS. They all do. A fucking FACE is now on their VIEWSCREEN. A ROMULAN FACE -- the FIRST OFFICER of the Na whom we'll come to know as AYEL:
My commander requests the presence of your captain in order to negotiate a cease-fire. You will come aboard our ship via shuttlecraft. Your refusal would be unwise.
Screen goes DEAD. All eyes on Robau... and he feels them. tense, horrible moment. Finally, to the First Officer:
Walk with me.
The First Officer follows Robau OFF THE BRIDGE AND INTO:
As they walk, briskly:
If I don't report within fifteen minutes, execute general order 13.
Sir, we could issue a mayday call to--
(frightened, but firm) There is no help for us out here. If we're going down, we're taking them with us -- you save as many as you can.
... aye, Captain.
Robau heads into a waiting TURBOLIFT, turns -- they lock knowing what this means. Finally:
You're Captain now. Mr. Kirk.
He's gone.   And we realize this is GEORGE KIRK, Jim's fa
All eyes on Kirk as he enters -- moves to the captain's c Sits. Not a small moment. Speaking his first words as Cap
Lieutenant Pitts. Transfer Robau's vital signs to the main view screen.
Yessir. In a moment, Robau's VITAL SIGNS appear on various monito his HEART RATE, OXYGEN LEVELS, BLOOD PRESSURE, all of it. PITCHED BEEPBEEP of his HEARTBEAT is now HEARD --
Vitals on line.
(slightly awkward)
-- thank you.
TILT DOWN as the TURBO-LIFT DESCENDS -- we PUSH IN as the open and Captain Robau gets out -- moves quickly -- hurri a SHUTTLE BAY catwalk --
Robau enters a shuttle -- LIGHTS BLINK to life.   He move cockpit -- starts the vehicle up --
Computer, initiate departure sequence. A LOUD HISS and the craft SHUDDERS as it disembarks --

Sparks dripping from the ceiling, everyone is motionless on the monitors -- and we're TIGHT ON GEORGE KIRK -- the of Robau's heart might as well be representing his own. H realizes he's sweating -- wipes his forehead as:
The shuttle's pulling out of main bay, Sir.
I want to see him -- floodlights please.
Two MASSIVE FLOODLIGHTS on the Kelvin's dish GO HOT -- an FLARING out the lens -- landing on the SHUTTLE as it leav KELVIN, heading toward the imposing Narada.
Backlit by the distant floodlights, Robau remains steely- he moves for the darkened ship -- nerves --
And Robau's HEARTBEAT QUICKENS -- the tension they all fe
His heart rate's elevated--
He's scared.
He's brave.    That's what he is.
Robau watches as he gets closer, the BEEPBEEPING HEARD ov SOUNDS of the shuttle -- but then --

ALL WE HEAR IS THE LOW-PITCHED BEEPBEEP as the small shut seems to get swallowed up by the massive forward-facing s of the Narada -- the distant floodlights creating EERIE S everywhere. A gigantic IRIS DOOR TURNS, SLOWLY OPENS -- a shuttle enters the Narada's main HANGAR -- the door CLOSE
And everyone is just motionless and silent. Only Robau's SIGNS can be HEARD, BEEPING away. George's eyes glued ahe

TIGHT ON ROBAU as he faces the shuttle door, considering fate. Finally the SHUTTLE DOOR OPENS -- standing there ar eight ROMULAN GUARDS, brandishing WEAPONS. He steps down. grab him, hard -- he's SCANNED -- FRISKED -- PULLED ALONG we REVEAL the absolutely MASSIVE HANGAR, the insane archi of the interior of this dark, wet, dripping ship --

Robau is led into the enormous, dark bridge. A dozen Romu at controls. Robau does his level best to portray confide he is led up a walkway to AYEL. Behind him, sitting silho and motionless, turned away and looking off, is his capta presence always felt in this scene. This is NERO. Ayel touches a panel, then THROWS AN IMAGE into the air b Robau. A ROTATING HOLOGRAM OF A UNIQUE-LOOKING SPACECRAFT will refer to it as the JELLYFISH).
Are you familiar with this craft? Robau regards it.   Then:
Who is your commander? (silence, then re: Nero)
Is it him?
You will speak only to me.
Then ask your commander what right he has to attack a Federation vessel.
That was hardly an attack. My commander will easily destroy your ship. If you do not respond to the question. Robau considers the hologram again.     And what his answ mean for the fate of his crew.
I've never seen it. Or any ship like it.

Are you familiar with -- or better, know the location of -- Ambassador Spock? Ayel has thrown another HOLOGRAM -- A FLOATING, ROTATING OF SPOCK, who appears to be 75 earth-years old. The baby, just three years earlier. Robau is as confused as we are.
I am unfamiliar with Ambassador Spock.
A final question. What is the current stardate?
(the fuck?) ... Stardate? ... it's 2233.04. (finally) ... hey, where are you from--?
Suddenly: TSCHING! Nero's activated his STAFF -- FOUR LAR

CHARGING ROBAU WITH A ROAR AND ROBAU'S EYES POP HOLY SHIT

text: BLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE... Robau's vitals go dead.      PUS KIRK as a SCREAMING ALARM IS HEARD --
They're launching again!           Evasive! Evasive! Delt maneuver! Fire full-spread!
The Kelvin BANKS as it FIRES WILDLY -- another TORPEDO BL FROM THE NARADA -- it SEPARATES -- some miss, OTHERS HIT!
Debris FLIES TROUGH THE CEILING, SLAMMING INTO A BRIDGE S BEAM! Green COOLANT SPEWS from under the floor grating --
I'm initiating General Order 13! Set self-destruct for maximum matter- antimatter yield! Two minute countdown!
Yessir!
I want auto-pilot targeted for their fuel cells!
Sir, unable to locate the ship's power source!
Then just target the damn thing dead center!
We got bigger problems: the first hit destroyed auto-pilot!
The only way we're gonna ram that ship is to fly manual control!
TIGHT ON GEORGE as this lands.      More honorable than t
-- then I'll do it myself -- get to the shuttles, now! (no one moves until:)
Agony in the faces as they reluctantly hurry off -- Kirk the Captain's chair, hits the COMLINK:
All decks, this is the Captain speaking -- evacuate the ship immediately, get to your designated shuttle crafts --
MOVE FAST around Winona, in fucking labor now -- being transferred onto a wheelchair by the Doctor and Nurse--
-- repeat: evacuate ship and get to designated shuttles           -- that's George's v NOW!                                 what's happening?
We're packing it up -- you'll deliver in the shuttle!
-- and she's on the move, out the door as her COMMUNICATO SOUNDS -- she answers --
-- George!
Alone now on the bridge, piloting this massive craft by h - George talks to Winona from the Captain's chair --
I have medical shuttle 37 standing by, get to it now -- can you do that?
Yes -- where are you?
HOLD ON GEORGE for a moment as he hesitates -- his eyes g the screens as he pilots --
I'm on my way.
Good-- and George, it's coming-- our baby, it's coming now.
PUSH IN on him, his heart shattering -- having to out-man incoming torpedoes, piloting the ship to its doom -- stil forces optimism:
I'll see you in a minute, sweetheart.
He disconnects -- another ALARM -- he TURNS the ship, FIR
The Kelvin BANKS AGAIN -- its PHOTONS SLAMMING INTO THE O
CREW MEMBERS scramble to their shuttles as the ship TREMB and we find WINONA among them, being PUSHED through the m
The Med-Team ARRIVES with Winona in the wheelchair-- it's - and for Winona, a huge contraction --
-- Agh!   That was-- that was a big one!
-- as they put her into the shuttle bed:
Just keep breathing, Honey, you're gonna be just fine--
(through the pain) -- the baby, too, right?
-- the baby too.
As George Kirk pilots, he checks the monitors -- one read
SECONDS...) and another reads IMPACT PROXIMITY (36,054 ME 36,042, 36018...).
Another screen that shows stats of DEPARTING SHUTTLES -- leaving as we glance at the screen -- but SHUTTLE 34 REMA
The NARADA is GROWING in the viewscreen -- he hits the co
Captain to shuttle 37 -- is my wife on board?
The PILOT is readying the controls --
Yessir, she is--
I need you to go now, d'you hear me?
We're waiting for you, Sir--
No-- go, take off, immediately.
... yessir!
Shuttle Pilot works the controls -- and Winona, in the ba feels the shuttle SHUDDER --
Wait! We can't go, my husband isn't here yet! Please! STOP--!
-- but she's suddenly WINCING as another CONTRACTION hits
You'll need to push now-- are you ready?
Clamps holding the shuttle SLAM BACK, the MED-SHUTTLE DRO HARD, FUSION IMPULSE ENGINES IGNITE and the shuttle MOVES
George hits COMLINK -- a TONE -- then WINONA'S VOICE:
The shuttle's leaving-- where are you? As George EVADES ENEMY FIRE, heading for the massive alie
My love?   Listen carefully, okay?
Winona, holding her communicator --
-- we're about to have this baby --

Sweetheart... I'm not going to be able to be there. And she just stares -- realizing what's happening -- that been made Captain -- that there was an evacuation -- and she just KNOWS. Tears come to her eyes --
-- no-- no, no-- wait--

I want you to hear me. Please.                           Are you still on the sh -- There's no other way-- my      - no, you need to be he love-- you know all I want--      -- George, I can't do t all I want in the world is to     without you-- be with you--                        (crying now) -- please -- don't d--!
-- but she's WINCING AGAIN --
Okay-- you need to push. -- and she does -- the shuttle BANKS and --
-- and the shuttle LEAVES the Kelvin bay -- turning to jo DOZENS of other shuttles, all heading off in escape --
As George PILOTS, DODGING INCOMING -- we INTERCUT WITH:

Winona PUSHING -- giving birth to their baby -- and we're AND FORTH between a husband and wife that will never see other again, MUSIC SWELLING as the Kelvin TURNS HARD, avo TORPEDOES -- the shuttle BANKING as the Doctor and Nurse Winona -- and we're ON GEORGE as he HEARS A BABY CRYING - TEARS COME TO HIS EYES -- as he says--
Hey!   Hey, so what is it?
-- it's a boy.
It's a boy?   Yeah? And now we see Winona, handed this beautiful little boy. she cries, just looking at him --
Tell me... tell me about him-- please--
He's-- he's beautiful, he looks like you. Heartsick, George laughs -- glances at the MONITORS -- SE DESTRUCT COUNTDOWN IS AT T-MINUS 20 SECONDS -- oh God...
George, you should be here --
I know-- so what should we call him, huh?
We could name him after your father.
Tiberius? Are you kidding me? No, that's the worst-- we'll name him after your dad-- let's call him Jim.
... Jim.   Jim it is. Through the VIEWSCREEN -- he's ABOUT TO HIT -- the ship A within the enormous Narada blades -- George scared now --
Sweetheart? Sweetheart? I love you. Can you hear me?          -- yes-- yes, I hear -- I love you. I love y-- -- his VOICE CUT OFF as --
-- the Kelvin SLAMS INTO THE NARADA -- an EXPLOSION BEGIN

George's voice goes STATIC -- confusion washes over her f suddenly LIT BY A BRIGHT GLOW -- she looks over, with wet devastated eyes -- -- what she sees is the MASSIVE EXPLOSION -- quickly SUCK in the vacuum of space -- and she's CRYING -- holding her baby who just lost a father -- his life altered forever..
The shuttle SAILS AWAY with the others... HOLD ON THIS... long beat. Then PAN OVER to see NERO'S SHIP TUMBLING SILE THROUGH SPACE -- DEBRIS still raining from the explosion

MAYHEM: ALARMS and CREW work to stabilize the ship (OVERL ROMULAN DIALOG TO BE WRITTEN) -- we arrive at Nero, who, small specks of HUMAN BLOOD on his face, just STARES at t fucking HOLOGRAM OF SPOCK -- he's OBSESSED. Ayel works a monitor, yelling out something (in Romulan) of their men -- and as a result:

Gargantuan "BLADES" EXTEND from the ship like otherworldl -- and the ship begins to STEADY -- but then ANOTHER SHIP APPEARS -- DECLOAKING FROM NOTHINGNESS: a fucking KLINGON -- then ANOTHER -- AND ANOTHER --
And we're on Ayel as he witnesses, on his monitor, ships, popping up ALL AROUND THEM -- which is when they HEAR a V speaking KLINGON -- and we SUBTITLE:
Trespassing vessel: you have entered the jurisdiction of the Klingon Empire. Power down and prepare to be boarded or you will be destroyed.
Eyes wide, Ayel turns to Nero, still staring at Spock's i
(SUBTITLED, in Romulan) Commander Nero -- we're surrounded.
Finally Nero looks up.
(SUBTITLED, in Romulan) Sir-- what are your orders?
And we PUSH IN ON NERO as our MUSIC BUILDS, then we CUT T
CLOSE ON a young VULCAN BOY. 11 years old. SPOCK. He's standing in an abstract space -- IMAGES PROJECTED and HOV questions -- that he's answering as they appear, then dis
What is the square root of 2,396,304?                          -- one-thousand-five- forty-eight --
-- Correct. What is the central assumption of Quantum       -- everything that ca Cosmology?                          does happen, in equal parallel universes --
-- Correct. Identify the 20th century earth composers of the following musical progression:      -- Paul McCartney and Lennon.

-- Correct And we find ANOTHER VULCAN CHILD -- then ANOTHER -- all i odd spaces -- until we PULL BACK WIDE to reveal a large V LEARNING CENTER -- white "bowls", sunk into the dark grou where PROFESSORS walk, hands behind their backs, surveyin mass "mental martial arts" test. We're on ANOTHER VULCAN CHILD as she gets an answer wrong THE LIGHT OVER HER BOWL GOES OUT. Then ANOTHER CHILD -- w gets an answer wrong -- and HIS LIGHT GOES OUT. An EXTREM WIDE OVERHEAD SHOT reveals BOWL AFTER BOWL as the LIGHTS
Until only one bowl remains. Spock's. He finishes his las question. Gets it right. PUSH IN ON HIM as the COMPUTER S
Your score is one-hundred percent. Congratulations. Spock.
Off his face, we CUT TO MOMENTS LATER, as Spock collects things. As he does, three young VULCAN BULLIES walk up be him. Spock glances at them, then back to his things.
I presume you've prepared new insults for today.
Your mother lies with many men.
Spock just NODS.   Tries to ignore the fact that IT STING
I have no such information.
You are neither human, nor Vulcan -- and therefore, have no place in the universe.
(swallowing that too) This is your thirty-fifth attempt to elicit an emotional response from me. Logic dictates you would cease by now.
Look. He has human eyes. They look sad, don't they?
Perhaps an emotional response requires physical stimuli.
And Bully #2 PUSHES Spock -- who stumbles back, almost fa into one of the bowls. He looks up as:
He's a traitor, you know. Your father. For marrying her.
Spock stares -- we see him fighting the urge, but he's un

head_text.subj: AND HE CHARGES THE BULLY AND TACKLES HIM INTO THE BOWL

text: land inside -- Spock cries, flailing as he punches Bully The other two stand atop the bowl, stunned -- shocked -- what the hell to do -- and we CUT TO:
TIGHT ON Spock, chastened, sitting glumly on a bench. A m VULCAN CITY seen through the window behind him. His paren ARGUE at a distance down the hall:

-- where I'm from, when someone hits you, you hit back- - how is that not logical?         -- Spock had no reason -- They pick on him -- they        expectation of being tease him -- every day.            physically injured -- -- Which is precisely when reason must guide his actions

-- I want him to embrace           above all. Vulcan, you know that... but he has to be himself-- which means, occasionally, being         -- His "humanity" is v human.                             source of his ostracis -- When Vulcans get disgusted with each other, they never just walk away, do they?           -- No. -- Well humans do. And Amanda walks away, leaving Sarek standing there. He t sees his son down the corridor. Approaches. And we're PUS IN on Spock, studying the fear in his eyes. His father st front of him, looming there, looking down stoically:
I did not mean to create conflict between you and mother. After a beat, Sarek seems to soften a little.     No ange face. Takes a seat beside his son...
In marriage... conflict is...
... constant?
Natural. (a beat)
Emotions run deep within our race. In many ways, more deeply than in humans. Long ago, they nearly destroyed us... that is why we followed the teachings of Surak. Now you must choose.
... between you and mother? 2
Never, my son. But you may choose the ethic of logic. Logic offers a serenity humans seldom experience. The control of feelings... so that they do not control you.
They called you a traitor. (then) You suggest that I should be completely Vulcan... and yet you married a human... why?
Sarek is clearly conflicted by this.      But he holds st

As Ambassador to Earth, my duty is to observe and understand human behavior. Marrying your mother... was logical. (Spock seems disquieted) Spock. You are fully capable of choosing your own destiny. The question you are faced with... is which path you will take. This is something only you can decide.
BAM -- a door opens: 14 year-old GEORGE KIRK, JR. angrily the house, carrying a duffel. His angrier, redneckier UNC FRANK following. 11 year-old JIM KIRK nervously pursues t
Go ahead: go-- run away! You know I could give a damn!
-- wait-- no!    Where are you going?
Anywhere but here, far as I can get!
Which won't be far enough -- know what your problem is?! (big luggie spit) No one ever taught you respect! How to follow orders! Do as you're told! (to Jim) -- what the hell are you doing?
I-- I just don't want my brother to go.
Well I do-- and I asked you to wash the car! How many damn times do I need to repeat myself?! How many damn times? How many?
A glare to George and Frank walks off. Jim nervously foll his brother, pulling out a small, FLOATING DISC --
Please stay-- you can have my Flo-Yo!
George hits it away:

This isn't about toys, it's Uncle Frank. I can't take him anymore -- Mom has no idea what he's like when she's not here-- d'you hear him talking like he's our dad?! And that's not even his car you're washing! That was Dad's car! You know why you're washing it? Because he's gonna sell it!
Don't leave -- okay? We can tell Mom when she gets back from Africa.

She's gone for five more months, by then I'll be in a different system. (sees fear in Kirk) You're gonna be okay. You always are. Always doing everything right -- good grades and obeying every stupid order... (then) I can't be a Kirk in this house. Show me how to do that and I'll stay.
But Jim can offer nothing. George gives him a quick hug a walks off. Jim sadly watches his brother go.

Kirk washes a VINTAGE CORVETTE. Red, white top. Dumping t sponge in bucket, he's sadly cleaning, his mind spinning his brother's departure. Devastated. And he's wiping the soapy passenger window (SQEEEEEEAK!) the sponge, when he STOPS -- seeing the KEYS in the ignit PUSH IN ON HIS FACE as a devilish idea comes to his mind. LAP A LOUD SCREECH and we CUT TO:

head_text.subj: THE CORVETTE BLASTS ONTO SCREEN, FISHTAILING ONTO THE ROA

text: young Jim Kirk behind the wheel (NOTE: The SOUND of the e is a metallic WHIR -- not a gas engine). TIGHT ON JIM'S F he drives -- having never done this before, he's as nervo he is determined --

The CORVETTE SPEEDS -- while inside the car, Jim turns on updated, modified RADIO -- scans stations, momentarily lo control of the car -- but he's back on track as he finds ROCK SONG -- and HE'S STARTING TO FUCKING LOVE IT -- PILO SOMETHING THIS FAST FEELS GOOD. He reaches for a CONVERTIBLE ROOF latch -- then the other with the speed he's driving, THE ROOF RIPS RIGHT OFF THE CAR -- Jim glances back, wide-eyed -- and the roof TUMBLE through the air, landing on the road -- and we PUSH AND A AROUND, as a POLICE OFFICER runs out from taking a roadsi -- he races back, jumps on his HOVERCRUISER and TAKES OFF
BACK IN THE CORVETTE -- BLOOPBLOOP!!! -- Jim's eyes dart REARVIEW as the cruiser WEAVES behind him -- then PULLS U BESIDE HIM -- the COP sees a CHILD driving and is AMAZED calls through his PA:
Son, you pull over that car! But Jim just BLASTS the RADIO LOUDER:

George, bag over shoulder, thumb out. He turns at the SOU the SIREN -- sees what's approaching... that car... looks familiar... and the THE CORVETTE SHOOTS PAST HIM, JIM AT WHEEL -- then the POLICE HOVERCRUISER! George runs into t middle of the road, mouth agape --

-- no... way. Back at the Corvette, Jim YANKS the steering wheel TOWARD COP -- who RISES to avoid the Corvette, which SCREECHES o perpendicular DIRT ROAD, kicking up wild dust as the Cop QUICKLY to follow --

Jim is now officially LOVING THIS -- and he DRIVES THROUG FENCE -- CRASH! The Cop RACES through it, in the Corvette DUST -- and we PUSH IN on a SIGN that reads "DANGER - QUA AHEAD -- IOWA MINING CO." In fact --
We see the MASSIVE QUARRY -- hundreds of feet deep -- and UP to the Corvette and Cop speeding toward it --

KIRK, EYES INTENSE, ALMOST SUICIDAL -- this is where he's headed all along -- and for a moment we think holy shit - is how James Kirk dies. He speeds toward the edge -- CLOS CLOSER -- but at the last second, Kirk SLAMS the brake -- car SKIDS -- PIVOTS -- and he LEAPS FROM THE CAR, WHICH S SIDEWAYS OFF THE CLIFF EDGE -- FALLING... falling... the comes to QUICK a STOP in CLOUDS of DUST as the Corvette E
The angry Cop hops off his hovercruiser, hand on weapon, Kirk, out of breath, exhilarated, gets to his knees.
What's your name, son?
And as he stands, we PUSH IN on him -- LOW and WIDE -- da that kid doesn't have a swagger. It's like the first time ever stood in his life.
My name's Kirk. James Tiberius Kirk.
And as our MUSIC BUILDS we CUT TO:

CONSTANT SHOCKS OF LIGHT as an ALIEN PRISONER -- intellig pedal, but with FOUR TERRIFIED EYES -- is SLAMMED DOWN on wet pavement -- a CHOKE STICK SHOVED under his chin -- th VOICES. Brutal, guttural KLINGON --
(SUBTITLED) You say they are not yours...
WHIP PAN TO SEE the scary KLINGON GUARDS -- four of them standing above the Alien -- chilling MASKS hide their hid faces -- and one holds a FLUORESCENT SET OF PAGES --
... these Federation maps we found in your pockets.
And the ALIEN SPEAKS -- an UNKNOWN LANGUAGE -- all eyes w
(SUBTITLED) I speak the truth. I do.
Then who are they for?
But the Alien just SHAKES HIS HEAD, afraid -- he will not So they GRAB HIM AND YANK HIM UPWARD --
You would rather die then tell us?
PUSH IN TIGHT as the Alien finally WHISPERS, terrified:

And the Guards look at each other... seemingly with conce MOMENTS LATER EIGHT GUARDS WALK TOGETHER -- and we PAN WI to reveal the HORRIFYING EXPANSE THAT IS THE KLINGON PRIS YARD. We realize that the constant shocks of light was LIGHTNING, that apparently never stops here. A SUPER READ "RURA PENTHE - KLINGON PRISON ASTEROID". And we see they' heading for a MUSCULAR FIGURE, using a SLEDGE HAMMER, SPL ROCKS, lit brilliantly by the lightning strikes. BOOM UP find that it's NERO. And he stops, SENSING the coming Gua And he manages a small smile. And he QUICKLY TURNS to the THEY ALL STOP, SUDDENLY. Afraid of him. One of them tosse Nero a set of MANACLES. Nero picks them up. Puts them on. offers his cuffed hands, willingly.
Guards drag Nero through the massive pyramidal structure.

Nero's ARMS AND LEGS get STRAPPED IN TIGHT. Go WIDE to re he's pinned to an interrogation table -- three GUARDS. A KLINGON INTERROGATOR approaches; looms over Nero, studyin Romulan's face with clinical detachment...

(SUBTITLED KLINGON) I have come far to meet you. "The One Who Does Not Speak." Ten years is a long time to maintain silence. (beat) Perhaps you simply do not speak Klingon, just as I do not speak Romulan.
(ENGLISH now) But I assume we both speak the language of our common enemy.
UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.) He reveals a worn LEATHER JOURNA Opens it, flips through it almost casually... we see SKET the JELLYFISH SHIP, PAGES OF COMPLICATED MATH EQUATIONS..

We found this book in your cell. Cartography, mathematics-- what do these mean? This date here -- eleven years from now-- what happens then? (holds up the FLUORESCENT MAPS) And why attempt to smuggle in maps of Federation space?
Nero's face betrays nothing; no fear, no doubt. Cold as f ice.   The Interrogator happens to stare at a page in the A DRAWING OF SPOCK. He closes the book.
When you were captured we assumed you were a spy, sent from Romulus to surveil the Empire. But because the Romulans deny your existence, I believe you are much more than that.
Interrogator looks over to the Guards, nods. A Guard appr with some kind of GLASS CONTAINER; we HEAR something wet FLOPPING around inside, but we can't SEE what it is.
Your ship remains in orbit above us now. We've been asking for its secrets for too long. That is why I am here. We want to know how it works and I believe now, finally... you will tell us.
A Guard uses TONGS to pull out the most DISGUSTING creatu you've seen from the container: a SLUG with SUCKERS and s covered in a grimy muck -- it FLIP FLOPS.
Centaurian slugs. Their native planet is in constant sunlight. As a result, there's nothing they hate more... than darkness.
A Guard GRABS NERO'S HEAD and FORCES IT BACK; the second HIS MOUTH OPEN with his hands.

Another Guard SHOVES THE THING INTO NERO'S MOUTH -- Nero his eyes open -- furiously determined not to be broken -- they FORCE HIM TO SWALLOW IT -- he DOESN'T SCREAM as the wretched thing makes its way down his esophagus and into stomach --

They try to claw and bite their way out of any dark space they're in. Nero stares at the ceiling in HORRIFYING INTERNAL PAIN -- straining to block it out. PUSH DOWN on Nero's wide, craz eyes -- TIGHTER as we SLOWLY DISSOLVE TO SEE WHAT HE'S SE

head_text.subj: WHAT'S KEEPING HIM FROM LOSING HIS MIND

text: Quiet. A waiting area. AMANDA, Spock's mother, stands alo a passageway. She looks off-camera to her son:
Spock, come here, let me see you.
(beat)
No.
Spock. Reluctantly, Spock walks into frame. She begins adjusting collar. This is our ADULT SPOCK. Gripped by anxiety but t like hell to look impassive.
There is no need to be so anxious. You'll do fine.
I am hardly "anxious", mother. (beat, then, anxiously)

And "fine" has variable definitions. "Fine" is unacceptable. She just smiles as she works his collar. He sees this and annoys him. He tries to move her hands away, to stop with collar -- his annoyance, her love for him, all sweet-- bu doesn't let go of her hands. A meaningful silence between
May I ask a personal query?
... anything.
Should I choose to complete the Vulcan discipline of Kolinahr... and purge all emotion... I trust you will not feel it reflects judgement upon you.
She stares at him, moved.      Touches his face.
As always... whoever you choose to be... you will have a proud mother.
HOLD on mother and son, worlds apart but forever bonded:
An imposing yet BEAUTIFUL INDOOR ATRIUM. Spock stands bef the VULCAN HIGH COUNCIL. Among faces on the dais: his FAT seated beside the SCIENCE MINISTER and other VULCAN LEADE
You have surpassed the expectations of your instructors. Your final record is flawless. With one exception. I see you have applied to Starfleet as well.
It was logical to cultivate multiple options.

Logical but unnecessary. You are hereby accepted to the Vulcan Science Academy. A distinction all the more significant given that you will be its first half- human pupil. It is truly remarkable, Spock. That you have achieved so much despite your disadvantage. Welcome to the Academy.
They all start to rise.      But Spock is suddenly unsett
If you would clarify, Minister-- what "disadvantage" are you referring to?
... your human mother.

As the council disperses, we PUSH IN on Spock's face -- t look he had when he took punches as a kid. He glances at father to say something, but Sarek's the consummate diplo His eyes command: remain calm. Spock STRUGGLES... then ma the first spontaneous -- human -- decision of his life --
Council -- ministers.    I must decline.
Everyone STOPS.   A solid BEAT.   Confused looks turn col
No Vulcan has ever declined admission to this academy.
Then as I am half-human, your record remains untarnished.
Spock. You have made a commitment to honor the Vulcan       At the moment, Fathe way--                                think of no greater
Why did you come before this council today? Was it to satisfy your emotional need to rebel?

I came with the intention of enrolling, as my father wished. However, your "insight" has convinced me otherwise. Therefore, the only emotion I wish to convey is gratitude. Thank you, Ministers, for your consideration. (a contained "fuck you") Live long and prosper.
He looks to his father, whose disappointment is evident - still, God bless him, Spock walks out --

-- PUSH DOWN A HALLWAY -- MUSIC HEARD -- what seems like is going on through windows in the double-doors ahead -- WOMAN SWOOPS INTO VIEW in front of us -- we PUSH BEHIND H the short skirt and high boots as she ENTERS the place -- local, busy BAR -- the woman makes her way to the BAR, an see her GORGEOUS, DIGNIFIED FACE. THIS IS UHURA. She lean into the bartender warmly, her smile glorious:
Hi. I'd like a Klabnian Fire Tea, two Cardassian Sunrises and three Earth beers, no slim-shots, anything on draft.
That's a lot of drinks for one woman. Wearing those boots.
JAMES KIRK'S FACE leans in: at 22, he's charming, witty, dangerous, rebellious. He grins at her, flirty. Uhura giv him a look, then back to the bartender:
And a shot of Jack, straight up.
(to the bartender) Make it two -- her shot's on me.
Her shot's on her. Thanks but no thanks.
Don't you want my name before you completely reject me?
I'm good without it.
Damn, he likes her already.
You are good without it. It's Jim. Jim Kirk. (long beat) If you don't tell me your name, I'm gonna have to make one up.
(beat) Uhura.
Uhura? No way -- that's the name I was gonna make up for you. Uhura what?
Just Uhura.
They don't have last names in your world?
Uhura is my last name.
They don't have first names in your world? Wait, let me guess. Is it "Jim"? That makes her smile.    So he moves closer to her:
Okay, so you're a cadet. Studying. What's your focus?
Xenolinguistics. Lemme guess: you don't know what that means.
Let me guess: study of Alien languages: phonology, morphology, syntax-- it means you've got a talented tongue.
And for a moment I thought you were just a dumb hick who only has sex with farm animals.
Well.    Not only.
You think you're smart.
Oh, baby, I'm the smartest. Something sad in that.    A BURLY STARFLEET CADET appears
This guy bothering you?
Beyond belief, but nothing I can't handle.
You could handle me.    That's an invitation. The Burly Cadet spins Kirk around:
Hey.    You mind your manners.
At ease, Cup Cake, it was a joke.     Like your hairline. Uhura turns back.    The other cadets, seeing trouble, ap
Hey -- Jim: enough.
What was that?
You heard me, Moon Beam.
You know how to count farm boy?    There's five of us... and one of you.

Okay, so go get some more guys, come back and it'll be an even fight. The cadet swings his fist but Kirk HEADBUTTS HIS HAND, BR IT -- another Cadet PUNCHES KIRK, then THROWS HIM into a which Kirk FLIES OVER, landing hard -- another Cadet GRAB pulls him up -- Kirk SLAMS FIVE FAST PUNCHES that send th back -- when ANOTHER CADET PUNCHES HIM -- yet another HOL -- and that last punch is repeated THREE-- then FOUR time

Enough!    STOP! Another punch and Kirk FLIES TO THE FLOOR - he's out of i won't give up. The Cadets UNLEASH on him and really PUMME - and Kirk's spirited, but LOSING -- about to LOSE BAD -- an EAR-SPLITTING WHISTLE makes everything STOP -- they tu standing in the doorway is a tall, rugged Starfleet offic CAPTAIN CHRISTOPHER PIKE.
Outside, all of you!       NOW! The cadets file out, in for it. Pike moves to a dazed, se conscious Kirk, now upside down on a table.
Y'alright, Son?
You can... whistle really loud, y'know that? -- and Kirk PASSES OUT.
HIGH WIDE OVERHEAD SHOT of the almost-closed bar. Only Ki Pike sit here at a table. Kirk's bloodied, tissue in his
I couldn't believe when the bartender told me who you are.
... and who am I, Captain Pike?
Your father's son. (then, smiles)
For my dissertation, I was assigned the U.S.S. Kelvin. Something I admired about your dad... he didn't believe in no-win scenarios.
He sure learned his lesson.
Depends on how you define winning. You're here, aren't you? (off Kirk's look)
That instinct to leap without looking-- that was his nature, too. And in my opinion it's something Starfleet has lost. We're admirable, respectable. But overly-disciplined. (beat)
Those cadets you took on, they'll make competent officers -- but you can bet your ass they'll run home to momma the minute they're looking down the barrel of a Klingon phaser cannon.
-- why are you talking to me?
I looked up your file while you were drooling on the floor. Your aptitude tests were off the charts-- what is it, d'you like being the only Genius Level repeat-offender in the midwest?
Maybe I love it.
So your daddy dies... you can settle for a less-than-ordinary life. (beat) Or do you feel like you're meant for something better? Something special?
And that just hangs there for a beat. Because Pike just h nerve. Kirk does his best not to show it -- still absent- mindedly fiddling with STARFLEET SHIP SALT AND PEPPER SHA
Come to think of it, I do want to feel special. You know what? I'm gonna go start a book club--
Enlist in Starfleet.
Enlist. You must be way down on your recruiting quota for the month--
If you're half the man your father was, Jim, Starfleet could use you. You could be an officer in four years, have your own ship in eight.
He's getting under Kirk's skin -- but Kirk keeps up the ' grabs his jacket, stands --
We're even, right?   I can go.
Riverside shipyard. Shuttle for new recruits leaves tomorrow, 0800. (Kirk turns, Pike grabs him) Your father was Captain of a Starship. For twelve minutes. I dare you to do better.
Eyes lock... and it's now Pike who stands and walks off. that's where it hangs. Off Kirk, brooding...
CORN STALKS whipping by -- Kirk on his SPOKELESS MOTORCYC rocketing across the plains -- his soul's been stirred an fighting it -- he cranks it, ELECTRIC ENGINE SCREAMING --

Kirk pulls up to us, kills the bike. Camera starts to MOV AROUND HIM -- he's dramatically BACKLIT and we COME AROUN an INCREDIBLE REVEAL of a SHIPYARD -- at its center, the skeletal frame of a NEW SHIP under arclights. UNMISTAKABL U.S.S. ENTERPRISE. Unformed, raw, like its future captain MUSIC SWELLS, we PUSH IN ON HIM, considering Pike's offer future, his fate.
The shipyard is abuzz with activity -- cadets loading int shuttle -- and Pike, staring off, waiting. The PILOT approaches:
Waiting for something, Cap?

... No.   Guess not. He climbs in. The pilot rapidly flips through switches, r a pre-flight sequence. Pike straps in. Glances through th viewshield... SEES SOMETHING... and he smiles. From his P KIRK on his MOTORCYCLE, driving into the shipyard --
Hold her a second... Kirk rides past a WATERFALL of cooling tanks -- stops the near the shuttle -- steps off, has nothing -- no bags -- the clothes on his back.
Nice ride, man. Kirk kicks the stand, tosses the guy the startcard --
Live it up. Kirk walks past the startled worker and approaches Pike.

Four years?   I'm gonna do it in three. Pike grins as Kirk passes him. Inside the shuttle, Kirk moves down rows of new recruits, of them ALIEN. Passes UHURA and the BARFIGHT CADETS, who UP when they see him -- one has a BANDAGED HAND.
At ease, Gentlemen. (then, to Uhura) Never did get that first name.
(can't help it: a grin) And you never will.
He smiles as he takes a seat at the back of the shuttle. in as it RISES...
Are you people deaf? I told you I don't need a doctor, damnit! I AM A DOCTOR!
Kirk turns to see a MAN being forced OUT of the BATHROOM FEMALE FLIGHT OFFICER -- at 34, he has a Southern lilt an like a prisoner waiting for the guillotine to fall:
-- you need to find a seat --     -- I had one, in the ba Darlin', with no windows --

-- Sir, for your own safety,      -- I suffer from Aviaph siddown, or I will MAKE you       case you don't understa sit down... do you hear me?       words, it means 'fear o RIGHT NOW.                        in something that flies They GLARE at each other, then the man drops into the sea beside Kirk. The ship TORQUES to one side and the man GRI armrests, pale, sweating -- glances at Kirk:
I might throw up on you.
I think these things're pretty safe--

Don't pander to me, kid: one tiny crack in the hull and our blood boils in thirteen seconds -- solar flare might crop up, cook us in our seats -- Hell, some of the damn passengers are blue. And wait'll you're sitting pretty with a case of Andorian shingles, see if you're still so relaxed when your eyeballs are bleeding-- space is disease and danger, wrapped in darkness and silence.
I hate to break this to you, but Starfleet operates in space.
Yeah, well my ex-wife took the whole damn planet in the divorce, I got nowhere to go but up. Leonard McCoy.
Jim Kirk-- you really gonna throw up--?
Maybe-- As the TREK THEME SOARS, the shuttle ascends and we...
Nero lies on the floor of his cell, semi-conscious, looki death. Behind him the DOOR OPENS. Two KLINGON GUARDS ente backlit.

The day you've been waiting for is upon us, Silent One. And look. No sign of salvation. No sign of change. Just more pain. And they both lift his limp body up -- as something mirac happens -- NERO SNAPS TO LIFE AND SINGLE-HANDEDLY BEATS T
what seems like an instant, he's the only one standing he holding both of the Guards' rifles -- which he TWIRLS, ba
PUSH IN ON THE DOOR as it opens -- Ayel, chained, looks u intensely -- and sees that it's NERO who has arrived -- w IN TIGHT ON HIM as he SPEAKS FOR THE FIRST TIME:

The wait is over. Off Ayel, we CUT TO: 64H   EXT. STARFLEET ACADEMY GROUNDS - DAY   [FORMER SC. TILT DOWN from a GLIMMERING BUILDING TO REVEAL a sea of R CADET UNIFORMS: HUNDREDS OF CADETS head across campus, Mc Kirk among them. A miraculous view of San Francisco benea blue sky, Golden Gate Bridge piercing the air. Kirk strut
So you'll do it for me, right?
I have no interest.
I didn't ask if you have interest, I asked if you'd do it.
I'm about to ask you an obvious question: why bother?
Because I've failed the test twice.
And you're determined to make it three. We've all failed it-- everyone has, and that's the point! No one goes back for seconds, let alone thirds -- it's not like you need to pass it to graduate.
So Bones: why do they make us take it?
I told you to stop calling me that. You're very annoying.
And you're the greatest -- thank you.
You'd better study for it this time.
Oh, no-- Bones -- I gotta date.
A date? Listen, as smart as you are, which ain't much, if you don't prepare--
You have no idea how prepared I'm gonna be-- no idea.
And with a smile, Kirk heads off -- McCoy watches him go, calling after him:
Seriously, stop calling me Bones! (to himself, hating it) "Bones".
In MOONLIGHT, a beautiful WOMAN lies on her back, in some of bra, moaning in delight -- this is GAILA --
-- oh Jim... Jim... Jim, I love you.
(kissing her) ... Yeah. I sent you a message.
Gaila reaches over, turns on the light and we realize: SH GREEN. And not particularly happy:
I say "I love you", and you say "I sent you a message?"
-- but you can only open it tomorrow at three o'clock on the dot --                        -- what are you talking What is it? What does it say?

-- Gaila, promise me you're not going to open it 'till        -- what is it?    Tell three --                          it says! -- I'll erase it, I swear, if you don't promise me you'll       -- All right!!    Three wait --                           I prom-- They're INTERRUPTED by a DOOR OPENING -- GASP!
(sotto) You can't get caught in this dorm-- hide! Under the bed, quick!
Kirk falls, lands hard on the floor, SCRAMBLES under the Gaila's roommate enters -- UHURA. Dropping her backpack:
Hey-- I thought you were going to be in the long-range sensor lab all night.
I was supposed to be, but it was crazy, I picked up an emergency transmission from a Klingon prison planet -- there was an escape and a ship stolen from th-- (suddenly senses) ... you okay?
Yeah, been running simulations all week, just catching up on some rest. Tired. (fake yawn) That's all.
Uhura watches her.   Her eyes narrow.
Were you running simulations with the mouth-breather hiding under the bed?
Gaila freezes, caught.   Uhura looks down, Kirk PEERS OUT
Your hearing is scary-- you sure both your parents are human?
The hell are you doing with him in here?
I can't help it! I love him!      Gaila loves me--
Get outta here -- it's my ass too if administration catches you in this dorm.
(getting dressed, to Uhura) You and I have a big day tomorrow --
(pushing him out)
You're gonna fail.
If I pass, will you tell me your first name?
No.   Good night.
(quiet, tries to charm)
I think the fact that you picked up a transmission of a Klingon prison escape is very interesting. SHE CLOSES THE DOOR ON HIM and we CUT TO:
The Narada APPEARS through space --
Dead silence on the bridge... all eyes on the VIEWSCREENS starfield, roiling clouds of methane ice.
We have arrived at the coordinates you requested. Stardate confirmed. 2258.5. Nero stands, looks out through his view screens.
Standby. Ayel studies his console, hope in his eyes.     Quietly:
Captain... long range scans of Beta Quadrant complete. Romulus is there. She's there. We could go. Right now, go home...
Not yet -- not like this. Not how we left. This is our chance... to serve our people. We owe it to them -- to do what no other Romulan could ever do.
Ayel hides his disappointment behind his eyes as suddenly LIGHTNING STORM -- impossibly, from nowhere -- LOTS OF IT through the lightning erupts THE JELLYFISH -- THE SHIP NE BEEN LOOKING FOR DECADES.
Welcome back.    Spock.
And we won't know where we are as MUSIC BUILDS and we CUT
Uhura TURNS TO US, at her comm station -- PUSH IN on her. seems wildly BORED and almost RESENTFUL:
-- we are receiving a distress signal from the U.S.S. Kobayashi Maru. The ship has lost power and is stranded. Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them.
WHIP TO THE COMMAND CHAIR, where KIRK captains the batter bridge. Confident -- cocky:
"Starfleet Command has ordered us to rescue them... Captain."
She glares, turns away.      Then McCoy, at a console, re
Klingon vessels have entered the Neutral Zone. And they are firing upon us.
That's okay.
McCoy and Uhura -- and the others -- look at him, confuse
It's okay?
Yeah, don't worry about it.

McCoy and Uhura share a look -- that's when we CUT TO: 81B   INT. TESTING CONTROL BOOTH - CONTINUOUS [FORMER SC. Looking at the bridge from above, we PULL BACK to reveal observation room above the faux-ship. This is the test Ki referring to. CONSOLE TECHNICIANS monitor the proceedings TEST ADMINISTRATOR turns to another and asks:
Did he say "don't worry about it"?
-- what's he doing?

And we CONTINUE TO PULL BACK TO REVEAL that, sitting amon technicians, is Gaila. Our resident GREEN GIRL. She check watch -- PUSH IN ON IT: 2:59 PM. On her MONITOR awaits a century e-mail -- a MESSAGE FROM KIRK --
Three more Klingon Warbirds decloaking -- and targeting our ship -- I don't suppose this is a problem either?
Nah.
They're firing, Captain.
Alert medical bay to prepare to receive all crew members from the damaged ship.
And how do you expect us to rescue them when we're surrounded by Klingons?
Alert medical.
Annoyed, she does as:
Our ship is being hit -- shields at sixty percent.
I understand.
Should we at least, I dunno, fire back?
Mmmm... no.
Of course not.

CLOSE ON GAILA'S WATCH as it changes to 3:00 -- and she Jim's message -- and all it reads is, "I'M SORRY." And then something UPLOADS and EXECUTES and ALL THE SCREENS AND ON THE BRIDGE DIE -- THE SYSTEM CRASHES -- everyone
-- the hell's happening?!
The crew doesn't know what's up -- except Kirk, who is remarkably pleased -- when the LIGHTS AND MONITORS COME B things are not the same:
(perplexed, works controls)
-- the Kobayashi Maru is still in distress... but... the Klingons have stopped firing.
Arm photons. Prepare to fire on the Klingon warbirds.
Jim, their shields are up.
Are they? McCoy looks at his monitor.   No they're not.
Fire on all enemy ships -- one photon each should do -- let's not waste ammunition.
Target lock acquired on all warbirds -- firing! They fire -- AND DESTROY ALL FIVE KLINGON SHIPS INSTANTLY mouths here are agape.
Begin rescue of the stranded crew. So. We've eliminated all enemy ships, no one on board was injured and the successful rescue of the Kobayashi Maru crew is underway.
For the first time, Kirk looks up to the testing room win
Anything else?
And they're stunned up here, too -- Test Administrator #2 to someone OFF-CAMERA:
How the hell'd that kid beat your test?
REVEAL who he was talking to: SPOCK is here.      And not
... I do not know.
TIGHT ON a stern STARFLEET ACADEMY PRESIDENT:
James T. Kirk.     Step forward.
It's a huge Starfleet chamber. Golden Gate Bridge visible through huge windows. 500 cadets, a nervous KIRK among th He stands, moves to one of two PODIUMS.

An incident has occurred today that concerns the entire student body. Academic immorality by one is an assault on us all. It will. Not. Stand. Cadet Kirk, evidence has been submitted to this council suggesting you violated the ethical code of conduct pursuant to regulation 17.43 of the Starfleet code. Is there anything you care to say before we begin?
(uncomfortable beat) Yessir. I believe I have the right to face my accuser directly.
President nods toward the assembly. SPOCK RISES. He and K MEET EYES for the first time. It's clock-stopping.
Step forward please. This is Commander Spock, one of our most distinguished graduates. He's programmed the Kobayashi Maru test for the last four years.
Spock steps up to the OTHER PODIUM.      President nods.
Cadet Kirk. It is obvious you somehow managed to install and activate a sub- routine in the programming code, thereby changing the conditions of the test.
We happen to find GAILA, in the crowd, fucking pissed.
Your point being?
In academic vernacular, you cheated.
Respectfully.    Define "cheating".
To deceive by trickery.
Now let me ask you something I think we all know the answer to: the test is rigged, isn't it? You programmed it to be unwinnable.
Mr. Kirk, I don't see how the intent of the exam is relevant to these proceedings.
Because if I'm right, Sir, then the test itself is a cheat.
Your argument precludes the possibility of a no-win scenario --
I don't believe in no-win scenarios --
FIND PIKE amongst the officers in attendance. His eyes lo on Kirk. This is his boy. His recruit. And he's INVESTED.
Then not only have you violated the rules, you've failed to understand the principle lesson.
Please, enlighten me.
You, of all people should know, Cadet Kirk -- A captain cannot cheat death. ON KIRK. The first punch by Spock that landed.      The c slips away as he senses where this is going --
"I of all people?"
Your father, Lieutenant George Kirk, had assumed command of his vessel before killed in action, did he not? Shit.   The DADDY card.   Kirk, a mix of ANGER and EMBARR
How long did it take you to look that up?
How long did it take you to program the virus that allowed you to cheat? The President smirks; considers ending this now but doesn it's just too damn entertaining...
Maybe you just don't like that I beat your test.
I am Vulcan. "Like" is not a verb in our vernacular. I've simply made the logical deduction that you're a liar.
What an idiot I am for taking that personally --
Agreed. Furthermore, you have failed to divine the purpose of the test.
Enlighten me again.

The purpose is to experience fear. Fear in the face of certain death. To accept that fear and maintain command of one's self and one's crew. This is a quality expected in every Starfleet captain. Kirk absorbs that.   Then --
So you're telling me the point.      Of the whole thing. Is to be afraid?
Fear is necessary, yes.
Have you taken the test, Commander Spork?

Spock. As a Vulcan, I require no additional training to control my narcissism when making command decisions. No he DIN'T!   Kirk's hit guys for a lot less -- The crow but "OOOOOOHs." But Kirk ain't fucking done yet.

You keep reminding me that you're Vulcan. And I'm sure you're really proud of that, who wouldn't be-- but isn't it true you people don't experience fear at all? ON SPOCK. He raises that eyebrow. And Kirk sees... no mat how subtly... that he has fucking made CONTACT. Smelling
And if that's the case -- What's that say about your ability to make command decisions? Well. Looks like Kirk just hit him in HIS fucking weak sp And before this lovefest can continue --

A REDSHIRT bursts into the HALL -- Kirk turns to look -- all do -- now we're SPEEDING IN behind the REDSHIRT, who the President, hands him a DATAPAD. President reads it. Everyone watches, on edge -- finally, quietly:
(to all)
We've received a distress call from Vulcan. (Spock reacts concerned)

Cadet Kirk -- you are on academic probation pending the result of your hearing. Cadets, report to Shuttle Hangar One immediately -- this hearing is at recess until further notice -- dismissed. ... Fascinating.
There are so few Vulcans left.    We cannot afford to ignore each other.
Young Spock's eyes flicker in puzzlement...
Then why did you send Kirk aboard when you alone could've explained the truth?
(beat, simply) Because you needed each other. Opposing yet complimentary opposites. It was that balance between us -- I should say you and Kirk -- that often made the impossible, possible.
... it was a test?

(no: his heart heavy) I'm in no position to pass judgment... my actions have robbed you of much. I could not also deprive you the revelation of all you can accomplish together... of a friendship that will define you both in ways you cannot yet realize.
There is, to young Spock's surprise, vulnerability in tha
How did you persuade him to keep your secret?
I inferred universe-ending paradoxes would ensue should he break his promise.
You lied.
I implied.
A gamble...
An act of faith. One I hope you'll repeat in the future.
Young Spock considers an enduring friendship between him Kirk... for the first time, understanding it. But --
The future's not what it used to be... in the face of extinction, it's only logical I resign my Starfleet commission and help rebuild our race.
And yet, you are in a unique position... you can be in two places at once.
(beat)

I urge you to remain in Starfleet: I've already located a suitable planet on which to establish a Vulcan colony, and assist in the foundation of a new science academy. Young Spock takes that in, resolute...
My future cannot be determined by your past. We are one, but not the same.

Then I ask that you do yourself a favor. Put away logic. Do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. Spock Prime moves to the door, stops.    Offers the VULCA

As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. Their eyes hold. Spock turns, disappearing into the corri Young Spock stares at the empty doorway a beat, his mind jumble of thoughts... and our MUSIC BUILDS...

As Spock Prime walks off down the corridor, he passes rig man conferring with a nurse -- the man pauses, turns... i SAREK. Suddenly overcome by a feeling that the stranger w just passed him is... oddly familiar.

MUSIC STILL BUILDING -- glass walls reveal THE ENTERPRISE dock, UTILITY CRAFTS floating around it, repairing. Stand attention in rows, THE ENTERPRISE CREW -- over four hundr them wearing DRESS UNIFORMS -- TRACK DOWN the faces, all and we STOP ON YOUNG KIRK. Composed, focused, a man. The ACADEMY PRESIDENT stands at a podium:
This assembly calls Captain James Tiberius Kirk...
Kirk breaks from formation, pivots, marches down the hang past UHURA... SULU... CHEKOV... SCOTTY. All Beaming. Nota absent, is Spock. Kirk ascends the stairs, snaps to atten

Your inspirational valor and supreme dedication to your comrades are in keeping with the highest traditions of service and reflect utmost credit to yourself, your crew, and the Federation. For your... unique solution to the Kobayashi Maru, it's my honor to award you with a commendation for original thinking.
He opens a BOX -- glorious in repose, a MEDAL:
By Starfleet Order 28455, you are hereby directed to report to Commanding Officer, USS Enterprise, for duty as his relief.
Kirk turns. Walks to... PIKE. In a wheelchair now, wearin ADMIRAL'S UNIFORM. Overnight, his hair's turned totally g but despite his trauma, his pride's overwhelming. They SA
I relieve you, Sir.
I am relieved. Congratulations, Captain.
Pike containing a smirk, pins the medal to Kirk's chest.
Thank you, Sir.

Kirk turns to the crowd. Eyes shining. WILD APPLAUSE. As rejoins his crew for hugs and congratulations, we go to t of the hangar... SPOCK PRIME. Watching. Moved beyond word He turns and leaves them to it... and our MUSIC SWELLS as

The turbolift WHOOSHES open and in walks Kirk -- to every delight, wearing his iconic GOLD SHIRT. All around him, o crew -- young and fresh-faced but no longer children -- i charge of the greatest starship ever built:
Maneuvering thrusters and impulse engines at your command, Sir.
Weapons systems and shields on standby.
Dock control reports ready.    Yard Command signalling clear.
Scotty how are we?
Dilithium chamber at maximum efficiency, Captain.
(wry grin) Same ship, different day.
And Kirk pauses. His eyes go over to the empty science co with a sense of incompleteness. In fact, everyone on the feels it. A bitter truth they'll have to accept.
Mr. Sulu, prepare to engage thrus--
WHOOSH: the turbolift door opens.      SPOCK!!!   Wearing UNIFORM. Our hearts soar --
Permission to come aboard, Captain.
... Permission granted.
As you have yet to select a first officer, respectfully, I would like to submit my candidacy. Should you desire, I can provide character references.
Kirk nearly laughs. Spock's eyebrow goes up. Something pa between them... it carries acceptance, and trust...
It would be my honor, Commander. Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu.     Take us out.
Aye, Captain.
As the ship maneuvers out of dry dock, Spock takes his pl next to Kirk. Gold and blue, side by side.
And the ship crests the drydock portal, drifting into spa blessed one last time by the voice of our Vulcan hero:

Space... the final frontier. These are the continuing voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Her ongoing mission... to explore strange new worlds... to seek out new life forms, and new civilizations... To boldly go, where no one has gone... before...
The TREK THEME SOARS as the Enterprise warps off into a u of infinite possibilities...

Then I ask that you do yourself a favor... put away logic, and do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. And from around his neck, he removes the PENDANT that unt we've only caught glimpses of. Places it on the table bes his younger self. The feeling in his eyes is profound... SPOCK PRIME (CONT'D)
This was a gift to me.   Representing... a dream. One we were unable to fulfill. (softly)
The way you can now. And moves to the door.    Stops.   Offers the VULCAN SALU SPOCK PRIME (CONT'D)

As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. Their eyes hold. After considering a beat, he hits an activa button and a MOVING HOLOGRAPHIC MESSAGE materializes befo CAPTAIN JAMES T. KIRK. WILLIAM SHATNER.      As always, b confident -- and SINGING: KIRK/ SHATNER
Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you... (stops, grins)

I know I know, it's illogical to celebrate something you had nothing to do with, but I haven't had the chance to congratulate you on your appointment to the ambassadorship so I thought I'd seize the occasion... Bravo, Spock -- they tell me your first mission may take you away for awhile, so I'll be the first to wish you luck... and to say... (beat, emotional)
I miss you, old friend. 136
... and we're PUSHING IN on Young Spock, taking in the im Kirk's future self, the message, but above all -- the cle unquestionable friendship these two men had...

I look around at the new cadets now and can't help thinking... has it really been so long? Wasn't it only yesterday we stepped onto the Enterprise as boys? That I had to prove to the crew I deserved command... and their respect? And we STOP ON YOUNG KIRK. Composed, focused, proud. ... Same ship, different day. As Kirk rejoins his crew for hugs and congratulations, we the BACK of the hangar... SPOCK PRIME. Watching. Moved be words. He turns and leaves them to it... as he goes... KIRK/SHATNER (V.O.)

Our montage comes full circle as we END on Kirk's transmi KIRK/SHATNER
Who's to say we can't go one more round? By the last tally, only twenty five percent of the galaxy's been chartered... I'd call that negligent. Criminal even -- an invitation. (MORE) 138
KIRK/SHATNER (CONT'D)

You once said being a starship captain was my first, best destiny... if that's true, then yours is to be by my side. If there's any true logic to the universe... we'll end up on that bridge again someday. Stops, grins.   Because this is the part he needs to say KIRK
Admit it, Spock. For people like us, the journey itself... is home. Young Spock's face.   Lost in feelings that flood through 139
